glsa.title: PeerCast: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in PeerCast.

background.p: PeerCast is a client and server for P2P-radio network

description.p: Luigi Auriemma reported a heap-based buffer overflow within the "handshakeHTTP()" function when processing HTTP requests.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to the vulnerable server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the PeerCast server, usually "nobody".

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PeerCast users should upgrade to the latest version:
